how_to_use: Suggested Usage:.-Add this pre-shampoo rinse to your wash-day routine, one to two times a week, depending on your level of buildup..-On dry hair before shampooing, create small parts in the hair with the nozzle tip approximately one inch apart..-Squeeze the bottle and apply to the scalp from hairline to crown..-Massage thoroughly and leave on for 10 to 15 minutes..-Rinse well. .-Follow with shampoo and conditioner, as usual... reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, Fair skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: As an aesthetician I am obsessed with skin loving ingredients and The Rootist nailed it when they combined two power house Alpha Hydroxy Acids to truly clarify the scalp along with fermented rice seed extract known to aid in oil absorption.  Combined AHA’s in both glycolic acid as well as lactic, helping to aid in cellular regeneration as well as exfoliation of the scalp along with coffee seed. Real ingredients and no harsh chemicals like sulfates or parabens.  Lactobacillus, Ginseng root, Hops, and vinegar.  I love the added refreshing and cooling effect from the spearmint leaf and peppermint oil.  This is fantastic for both dry as well as oily scalps.  Any imbalance within the skin’s microbiome this treatment alleviates. Keep in mind that this is a pre shampoo treatment to be used on dry hair and left on for 10-15 minutes before rinsing out and following up with the Rootist Clarifying Shampoo and Conditioning treatment.  To use simply part hair in sections using the applicator tip and squirt out from top on scalp down to nape of neck.  Continue with parts until you have covered most of your scalp and gently massage in.  it is recommended to use 1-2x per week.  As with all AHA products there is a sunburn alert as this does make you more photo sensitive so be sure to wear a spf protection hat when going out.  This was an excellent prep to use a couple of days for my hair pre coloring.  I would recommend to use at least two days prior to any chemical treatments to prepare the hair and scalp.  Wait a minimum of a couple of days before color as you want a little natural oils built up on the scalp.  Love this treatment!
